Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 15 points in just nine minutes in the first quarter, 8 points shy of the Lakers' total points.
Mitchell cooled off in the second quarter, scoring only 2 points.
He scored only 7 points in the second half.
Mitchell ended the game with 24 points in 30 minutes, making 10 of 20 shots from the field and 4 of 10 shots from the 3-point line.
The Cavaliers annihilated the Lakers with a 134-110 win.
Pre-Game Insights: Donovan Mitchell had been one of the biggest factors behind the Cavs' revival in the last few seasons.
He opened his season with a 21-point game against the Toronto Raptors.
Mitchell had a bad game against the Detroit Pistons, scoring 19 points on 38.1% shooting from the field and 12.5% from the 3-point line.
In his third game, he scored his first 30-point game against the Washington Wizards, shooting 61.1% from the field and 54.5% from the 3-point line.
Donovan Mitchell had 25 points in the game against the New York Knicks, shooting 52.9% from the field and 37.5% from the 3-point line.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell made 3 rebounds, 7 assists, and 3 steals in the game.
The five-time All-Star also registered 1 offensive rebound and 2 defensive rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell never attempted a free throw in the game.
The Cavaliers star also registered 3 steals and 2 blocks in the game.
